articles.title: TC39 Meets Again and Advances Key Proposals
articles.description: The Ecma TC39 group that pushes forward the development of ECMA/JavaScript met again this week and moved several key proposals forward, including Deferred Import Evaluation, Error.isError(), RegExp escaping, and Promise.try.
articles.author: Sarah Gooding (Socket)

articles.title: Announcing TypeScript 5.5 RC
articles.description: This is shaping up to be one of TypeScript‚Äôs more significant releases, with popular dev-YouTuber Theo ‚ñ∂Ô∏è dropping a 30 minute video on what he‚Äôs calling ‚Äúthe biggest TypeScript release in years.‚Äù
articles.author: Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

articles.title: How to Compose JS Functions That Take Multiple Parameters
articles.description: ‚ÄúFunction composition is beautiful,‚Äù says James, who goes on to explain, in his usually elegant way, the use of partial application, currying, composite data structures, and more.
articles.author: James Sinclair

articles.title: 'I Tried React Compiler Today, and Guess What..'
articles.description: The recently unveiled React Compiler automatically memoizes things ‚Äì so can we ditch memo, useMemo and useCallback right away? Nadia investigates, finds the rough edges, and helps keep our feet on the ground.
articles.author: Nadia Makarevich

articles.title: 'How a Single Vulnerability Can Bring Down the JS Ecosystem'
articles.description: A slightly alarmist headline and it‚Äôs more about npm, but the issue outlined could have nonetheless posed big problems ‚Äì luckily, GitHub is on the case.
articles.author: Roni Carta (Lupin)

articles.title: Generating ZIP Files with JavaScript
articles.description: JSZip makes it easy to dynamically create an archive for users to download.
articles.author: Josh Martin

articles.title: Using Node.js's Test Runner: The Official Guide
articles.description: A new guide on the official Node site covering the fundamentals of using Node‚Äôs new test runner functionality, along with snapshot tests (supported by Node 22.3).
articles.author: Jacob Smith

articles.title: DGM.js: Infinite Canvas Library with Smart Shapes
articles.description: A library for rendering and working with infinitely pannable canvases that contain ‚Äòsmart shapes‚Äô that you can script and give various constraints and properties. GPLv3 licensed.
articles.author: Minkyu Lee

articles.title: Pastel 3.0: A Framework for Building Ink Apps
articles.description: Ink brings the power of JSX and React components to building command line apps. Pastel provides more structure on top of that in a Next.js fashion.
articles.author: Vadim Demedes

articles.title: uuid v10: Generate RFC-Compliant UUIDs
articles.description: Covers all major UUID standards. Works across all major browsers and Node 18+. v10.0 adds support for more types of RFC9562 UUIDs (namely v6, v7 and v8).
articles.author: Robert Kieffer and contributors

articles.title: JsonTree.js: Customizable Tree Views for JSON Data
articles.description: No dependencies, lots of customizations, and it‚Äôs easy to theme the trees using CSS variables. Try out some examples on the docs site.
articles.author: William Troup

articles.title: Turf.js 7.0: Geospatial Engine for Browsers and Node
articles.description: A collection of modules for doing spatial analysis, working with GeoJSON data, data classification, and more. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Morgan Herlocker

articles.title: Parvus 2.6: Accessible Lightbox with No Dependencies
articles.description: I love how it says not to use overlays on web pages but if you have to, use this! There‚Äôs a CodePen example.
articles.author: Benjamin de Oostfrees

articles.title: Bread Jam: Make Variables and Properties Easier to See in VS Code
articles.description: An interesting new VS Code extension that offers 11 different ways to make variable names stand out more in your editor, with both basic colorization approaches and an interesting emoji-based prefix option.
articles.author: Ting Wei Jing

articles.description: An industry survey has found while Rust's popularity is growing rapidly, but 'JavaScript continues to take the top spot for programming languages'.
The stabilization process of Deno's Standard Library has begun.
üáÆüá™ NodeConf EU is back, taking place in Ireland this November.
Nuxt 3.12 ‚Äì The Vue.js meta framework.
Bun 1.1.13 ‚Äì The one that isn't Node or Deno.
Node.js v22.3.0 (Current), Ember 5.9, Inertia 1.2, Astro 4.10
Lambda API 1.1 ‚Äì Zero dependency web framework for serverless JS apps.
TS-Pattern 5.2 ‚Äì Pattern matching library with smart type inference.
üóìÔ∏è React Big Calendar 1.13 ‚Äì GCal/Outlook-like calendar component.
YouTube.js 10.0 ‚Äì An unofficial way to use YouTube's internal API.
Starry Night 3.4 ‚Äì High quality GitHub-like syntax highlighting.
BlockNote 0.14 ‚Äì 'Notion-style' block-based editor.
Marked 13 ‚Äì Fast Markdown compiler / parser.

articles.title: WebKit in Safari 18 Beta
articles.description: Lots of news from WWDC24 for Safari, with this new beta adding in nearly 50 new web platform features, including View Transitions API support, Style Queries, new Passkeys features, and even WebXR experiences in Safari for visionOS. Plenty to dive into here.
articles.author: WebKit (Apple)

articles.title: How To 'Hack' Your Google Lighthouse Scores In 2024
articles.description: Lighthouse is influenced by a number of things that can be manipulated and bent to make sites seem more performant than they really are, as demonstrated here. Stuff like this is well worth knowing to ensure you‚Äôre not led down a path and misinformed on performance.
articles.author: Salma Alam-Naylor

articles.title: Promises from the Ground Up
articles.description: Josh notes that in order to truly understand promises, a fundamental part of modern JS development, we need ‚Äúa surprisingly deep understanding of how JavaScript works and what its limitations are‚Äù. Luckily, this tutorial covers all the critical context you need.
articles.author: Josh W Comeau

articles.title: CSS Container Queries
articles.description: A handy (and certainly bookmarkable) resource on container queries, outlining why you should care about them, what they can do, and when to reach for them. Plenty of solid examples and code here too.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: A Modern Approach to Browser Support
articles.description: Puts forward two foundational principles: the first touches upon accessible content and core functionality, with the second highlighting how it‚Äôs ok for sites to look different in different browsers.
articles.author: Richard Rutter

articles.title: Find Slow Interactions in the Field
articles.description: This article has recently been updated with fresh guidance on Interaction to Next Paint (INP), helping you figure out if you have an INP issue, how to measure for it and, in turn, interpret any data.
articles.author: Jeremy Wagner

articles.title: How Chrome Achieved the Highest Score Ever on Speedometer¬†3
articles.description: A look at how the Chrome browser has been further optimized thanks to the Speedometer 3.0 benchmark, resulting in performance gains for users.
articles.author: Thomas Nattestad (Chrome)

articles.title: Highlighting Areas the Browser Engine Repaints
articles.description: A quick look at how to highlight repainted areas of a page from  Chrome, Edge, and Safari devtools.
articles.author: Patrick Brosset

articles.title: Nested Anchor Links using CSS
articles.description: What to do when you want to nest an <a> tag within another <a> tag? (And why you might want to.)
articles.author: Amit Merchant

articles.title: The History of Browser Engines from 1990 to Now
articles.description: An interesting overview and timeline of browser engine marketshare over the past ~33 years.
articles.author: Alphonse Eylenburg

articles.title: üëÅÔ∏è Find Out Who Can Use Your Color Combination
articles.description: A really handy tool that brings attention and understanding to how color contrast can affect different people with visual impairments.
articles.author: Corey Ginnivan

articles.title: Share URL: Share a URL with Web Share, Copy to Clipboard or to Social Media
articles.description: A collection of simple and straightforward ways to provide a link sharing feature.
articles.author: Nigel O Toole

articles.title: JsonTree.js: A Lightweight Library to Render Customizable Tree Views for JSON Data
articles.description: No dependencies, lots of customizations, and it‚Äôs easy to theme the trees using CSS variables. Try out some examples.
articles.author: William Troup

articles.title: Reshot: 40,000+ Free Icons & Illustrations
articles.description: An extensive set of categorized icons and illustrations available in SVG and PNG formats, instantly downloadable, no attribution required, and available for commercial use.
articles.author: envato
